competitors.name: Finastra
competitors.notes: One of the largest fintech companies with comprehensive loan origination and core banking solutions

competitors.name: Temenos
competitors.notes: Leading banking software provider with cloud and on-premise solutions for retail and corporate banking

competitors.name: FIS
competitors.notes: Major provider of banking technology, payments, and core processing solutions

competitors.name: Jack Henry & Associates
competitors.notes: Technology solutions provider for community banks and credit unions with lending platforms

competitors.name: Fiserv
competitors.notes: Financial services technology offering core banking, digital banking, and lending solutions

competitors.name: Blend
competitors.notes: Digital lending platform focused on mortgage and consumer lending, competing in digital lending space

competitors.name: Ellie Mae (ICE Mortgage Technology)
competitors.notes: Mortgage origination software provider, acquired by Intercontinental Exchange in 2020

competitors.name: Q2 Holdings
competitors.notes: Digital banking and lending solutions provider for regional and community financial institutions

competitors.name: Salesforce Financial Services Cloud
competitors.notes: CRM platform for financial services, though nCino is built on Salesforce

context: 2020 was a pivotal year for nCino as the company went public (IPO in July 2020). By this time, nCino had established itself as a leading cloud banking platform with strong adoption among regional and community banks. The COVID-19 pandemic accelerated digital transformation in banking, benefiting cloud-native providers like nCino. Competition intensified as traditional vendors accelerated cloud transitions and digital-first competitors like Blend emerged.
